docstr: `IBITS` â€” Bit extraction ### Description `IBITS` extracts a field of length `LEN` from `I`, starting from bit position `POS` and extending left for `LEN` bits. The result is right-justified and the remaining bits are zeroed. The value of `POS+LEN` must be less than or equal to the value `BIT_SIZE(I)`. ### Syntax `RESULT = IBITS(I, POS, LEN)` ### Arguments . | `POS` | The type shall be `INTEGER`. | `LEN` | The type shall be `INTEGER`. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of the same kind as `I`. ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also BIT_SIZE, IBCLR, IBSET, IAND, IOR, IEOR
